	&nbsp;&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Explanatory Note
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	This Annual Report on Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	10-K
</FONT>
	is a combined report being filed separately by Comcast Corporation (&#147;Comcast&#148;) and NBCUniversal Media, LLC
	(&#147;NBCUniversal&#148;). Comcast owns all of the common equity interests in NBCUniversal, and NBCUniversal meets the conditions set forth in General Instruction I(1)(a), (b)&nbsp;and (d)&nbsp;of Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	10-K
</FONT>
	and is therefore filing its information within this Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	10-K
</FONT>
	with the reduced disclosure format. Each of Comcast and NBCUniversal is filing on its own behalf the information contained in this report that
	relates to itself, and neither company makes any representation as to information relating to the other company. Where information or an explanation is provided that is substantially the same for each company, such information or explanation has
	been combined in this report. Where information or an explanation is not substantially the same for each company, separate information and explanation has been provided. In addition, separate consolidated financial statements for each company, along
	with notes to the consolidated financial statements, are included in this report. Unless indicated otherwise, throughout this Annual Report on Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	10-K,
</FONT>
	we refer to Comcast and its consolidated subsidiaries,
	including NBCUniversal and its consolidated subsidiaries, as &#147;we,&#148; &#147;us&#148; and &#147;our;&#148; Comcast Cable Communications, LLC and its subsidiaries as
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage3"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D290430D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#147;Comcast Cable;&#148; Comcast Holdings Corporation as &#147;Comcast Holdings;&#148; and NBCUniversal, LLC as &#147;NBCUniversal Holdings.&#148;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	This Annual Report on Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	10-K
</FONT>
	is for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016. This Annual Report on
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Form&nbsp;10-K
</FONT>
	modifies and supersedes documents filed before it.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Securities and Exchange
	Commission (&#147;SEC&#148;) allows us to &#147;incorporate by reference&#148; information that we file with it, which means that we can disclose important information to you by referring you directly to those documents. Information incorporated by
	reference is considered to be part of this Annual Report on
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Form&nbsp;10-K.
</FONT>
	In addition, information that we file with the SEC in the future will automatically update and supersede information contained in
	this Annual Report on Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	10-K.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our registered trademarks include Comcast, NBCUniversal and
	the Comcast and NBCUniversal logos. This Annual Report on Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	10-K
</FONT>
	also contains other trademarks, service marks and trade names owned by us, as well as those owned by others.

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D290430D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<EFX_PART_I>
<A NAME="FIS_PART_I"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="4">
	Part I
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_BUSINESS>
<A NAME="FIS_BUSINESS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="4" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
<A NAME="D290430D10K_HTM_TOC290430_1">
</A>
	Item&nbsp;1: Business
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We are a global media and technology company with two primary businesses, Comcast Cable and NBCUniversal. We were incorporated under the laws of Pennsylvania in December 2001. Through our predecessors, we have
	developed, managed and operated cable systems since 1963. In 2011, we acquired control of NBCUniversal from General Electric Company (the &#147;NBCUniversal transaction&#148;), and in 2013, we acquired General Electric Company&#146;s remaining
	interest in NBCUniversal.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We present our operations for Comcast Cable in one reportable business segment, referred to as Cable
	Communications, and our operations for NBCUniversal in four reportable business segments: Cable Networks, Broadcast Television, Filmed Entertainment and Theme Parks (collectively, the &#147;NBCUniversal segments&#148;).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Cable Communications:
</B>
	Consists of the operations of Comcast Cable, which is one of the nation&#146;s largest providers of video, high-speed Internet
	and voice services (&#147;cable services&#148;) to residential customers under the XFINITY brand; we also provide these and other services to business customers and sell advertising.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Cable Networks:
</B>
	Consists primarily of our national cable networks, our regional sports and news networks, our international cable networks, and our
	cable television studio production operations.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Broadcast Television:
</B>
	Consists primarily of the NBC and Telemundo broadcast networks, our NBC and Telemundo owned local broadcast television stations,
	and our broadcast television studio production operations.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Filmed Entertainment:
</B>
	Consists primarily of the operations of Universal Pictures, which produces, acquires, markets and distributes filmed
	entertainment worldwide, as well as DreamWorks Animation, which we acquired in August 2016; our films are also produced under the Illumination and Focus Features names.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Theme Parks:
</B>
	Consists primarily of our Universal theme parks in Orlando, Florida and Hollywood, California and our 51% interest in the Universal
	Studios theme park in Osaka, Japan (&#147;Universal Studios Japan&#148;), which we acquired in November 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our other business interests consist primarily of Comcast Spectacor, which owns the
	Philadelphia Flyers and the Wells Fargo Center arena in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania and operates arena management-related businesses. We are also pursuing other business initiatives, such as a wireless phone service that we expect to launch in 2017
	using our virtual network operator rights to provide the service over a third party&#146;s wireless network.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	For financial and other
	information about our reportable business segments, refer to Item&nbsp;7: Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations, Note 17 to Comcast&#146;s consolidated financial statements, and Note 16 to
	NBCUniversal&#146;s consolidated financial statements included in this Annual Report on Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	10-K.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="4">
	Available
	Information and Websites
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Comcast&#146;s phone number is
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	(215)&nbsp;286-1700,
</FONT>
	and its principal
	executive offices are located at One Comcast Center, Philadelphia, PA 19103-2838. NBCUniversal&#146;s phone number is
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	(212)&nbsp;664-4444,
</FONT>
	and its principal executive offices are located at 30 Rockefeller
	Plaza, New York, NY 10112-0015. Comcast and NBCUniversal&#146;s
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">

	8-K
</FONT>
	and any amendments to such reports filed with or furnished to the SEC under Sections 13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;), are available free of
	charge on the SEC&#146;s website at www.sec.gov and on Comcast&#146;s website at www.comcastcorporation.com as soon as reasonably practicable after such reports are electronically filed with the SEC. The information posted on our websites is not
	incorporated into our SEC filings. The public may read and copy any materials filed with the SEC at the SEC&#146;s Public Reference Room at 100 F Street, NE, Washington, DC 20549. The public may obtain information on the operation of the Public
	Reference Room by calling the SEC at
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">

	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	Basis of Presentation: Customer metrics include our residential and business customers. All percentages are
	calculated based on actual amounts. Minor differences may exist due to rounding.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	(a)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	Homes and businesses are considered passed if we can connect them to our distribution system without further extending the transmission lines. Homes and
	businesses passed is estimated based on the best available information.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	(b)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	Customer relationships represent the number of residential and business customers that subscribe to at least one of our cable services. Single product, double
	product and triple product customers represent customers that subscribe to one, two or three of our cable services, respectively. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, we had 26.5&nbsp;million residential customer relationships.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	(c)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	Generally, a home or business receiving video programming from our distribution system counts as one video customer. For multiple dwelling units
	(&#147;MDUs&#148;) whose residents have the ability to receive additional cable services, such as additional programming choices or our high-definition video (&#147;HD&#148;) or digital video recorder (&#147;DVR&#148;) advanced services, we count
	and report customers based on the number of potential billable relationships within each MDU. For MDUs whose residents are not able to receive additional cable services, the MDU is counted as a single customer.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	(d)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	Penetration is calculated by dividing the number of customers by the number of homes and businesses passed.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

	&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage6"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D290430D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Cable Services
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We offer our video, high-speed Internet and voice services individually and as bundled services over our cable distribution system to residential and business customers. Our bundled service offerings aim to meet
	the needs of the various segments of our customer base, ranging from high-speed Internet services packaged with video or streaming services that include a limited number of channels, to a triple product bundle, consisting of our video, high-speed
	Internet and voice services. We also offer our home security and automation services as a component of our bundled service offerings. Subscription rates and related charges vary according to the services and features customers receive and the type
	of equipment they use, and customers are typically billed in advance on a monthly basis. The majority of our residential cable services customers are not subject to minimum-term contracts for their services, while substantially all of our business
	customers are. Minimum-term contracts are typically 2 years in length for residential customers and typically range from 2 to 5 years for business services customers. Customers with minimum-term contracts may only discontinue service in accordance
	with the terms of their contracts, which typically include an early termination fee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
	The Areas We Serve
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The map below highlights our footprint as of December&nbsp;31, 2016 and the designated market areas (&#147;DMAs&#148;) in which we offer cable
	services that have 250,000 or more customer relationships. The locations that are bolded represent the DMAs in which we operate that were also included in the top 25 U.S. television DMAs as of December&nbsp;31, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2017/02/03/0001193125-17-030512_G290430G75I58.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
	Video Services
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We offer a broad variety of video services under the XFINITY brand that provide access to hundreds of channels depending on the customer&#146;s level of service. Our levels of service typically range from a limited
	basic service with access to between 20 and 40 channels to a full service with access to more than 300 channels. Our video services generally include programming provided by national broadcast networks, local broadcast stations, and national and
	regional cable networks, as well as government and public access programming. We also offer packages that include extensive amounts of foreign-language programming and other specialty tiers of programming with sports, family and international
	themes. We tailor our video services for a particular geographic area according to applicable local and federal regulatory requirements, programming preferences and demographics.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
<B>
	3
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage7"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D290430D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our video customers may also subscribe to premium networks. Premium networks include networks such as
	HBO, Showtime, Starz and Cinemax that generally provide, without commercial interruption, movies, original programming, live and taped sporting events and concerts, and other features.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our video services generally include access to our video on demand service (&#147;On Demand&#148;) and an interactive,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	on-screen
</FONT>
	program guide. Our On Demand service provides video customers with over 100,000 programming choices over the course of a month, including approximately 40,000 in high definition. A substantial portion of
	our On Demand content is available at no additional charge; other content, primarily movies and special-events programming, such as sporting events and concerts, can be rented or in some cases purchased to own digitally. We continue to increase the
	number of On Demand choices we offer.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our HD service provides customers with high-resolution picture quality, improved audio quality
	and a wide-screen format through an HD
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	set-top
</FONT>
	box. Our HD service includes a broad selection of HD programming choices, including major broadcast networks, national cable networks, premium networks and
	regional sports networks. Our DVR service allows video customers to record and store programs and play them at whatever time is convenient. Our DVR service also provides the ability to pause and rewind live television. We refer to our HD and DVR
	services as &#147;advanced services.&#148;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We are actively deploying
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	set-top
</FONT>
	boxes for our
	Internet Protocol (&#147;IP&#148;) and cloud-enabled video platform, referred to as our X1 platform. Our X1 platform provides customers with integrated search functionality, personalized recommendations and access to certain third-party Internet
	applications, such as Netflix. We also offer our cloud DVR technology in substantially all of our markets. Cloud DVR technology allows our video customers to record programming using cloud-based servers and also view those recordings on mobile
	devices via our mobile apps.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Through our mobile apps and online portal, we offer streaming services that allow our video customers to
	view certain live programming and On Demand content, browse program listings, and schedule and manage DVR recordings. Depending on the customer&#146;s level of service, these services may require an additional monthly fee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
	High-Speed Internet Services
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We
	offer high-speed Internet services with downstream speeds from a range of up to 10 Mbps to fiber-based speeds up to 2 Gbps. These services include access to our online portal and mobile apps, which provide email, an address book, calendars and
	online security features. We are actively deploying wireless gateways throughout our footprint, which combine a customer&#146;s wireless router, cable modem and voice adapter, to improve the performance of multiple
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	IP-enabled
</FONT>
	devices used at the same time within the home, provide faster Internet speeds and create an
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	in-home
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Wi-Fi
</FONT>
	network. We
	are continuing to expand our network of residential, outdoor and business
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Wi-Fi
</FONT>
	hotspots to allow most of our high-speed Internet customers to access our high-speed Internet services inside and outside the
	home. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, there were approximately 15.8&nbsp;million of these hotspots.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
	Voice Services
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We offer voice services using an interconnected Voice over Internet Protocol (&#147;VoIP&#148;) technology. Our voice services provide either
	unlimited or usage-based local and domestic long-distance calling and include options for international calling plans, voicemail, voicemail transcriptions, text messaging, caller ID and call waiting. For customers with our high-speed Internet
	services, our voice services also include the ability to access and manage voicemail, text messaging and other account features through our online portal or mobile apps.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

</TD>

</TD>
<TD>
</TD>

</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>

	Comcast 2016 Annual Report on Form 10-K

</B>

<A NAME="eolPage8"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D290430D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
	Business Services
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We offer our cable services to small and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	medium-sized
</FONT>
	businesses and to large enterprises with multiple locations. Our large enterprise business services are designed for
	Fortune 1000 companies and other large enterprises with multiple locations both within and outside of our cable distribution footprint. We service these multiple locations through agreements with other cable companies to use their networks to
	provide coverage outside of our service areas. In addition to the features available to our residential cable services customers, our services for business customers include an interactive tool that allows customers to store, share, and collaborate
	on files online, hosted voice services that use cloud network servers, a business directory listing, and additional capacity for multiple phone lines.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We offer Ethernet network services that connect multiple locations and provide higher downstream and upstream speed options to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	medium-sized
</FONT>
	businesses and large enterprises.
	We also provide cellular backhaul services to mobile network operators to help those customers manage network bandwidth.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Advertising
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	As part of our distribution agreements with cable networks, we generally receive an allocation of scheduled advertising time on cable networks that
	we sell through our advertising business, Spotlight, to local, regional and national advertisers. In most cases, the available advertising units are sold by our sales force. In some cases, we work with representation firms as an extension of our
	sales force to sell a portion of the advertising units allocated to us. We also represent the advertising sales efforts of other multichannel video providers in some markets. In addition, we generate revenue from the sale of advertising online and
	on our On Demand service.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Other
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We also offer home security and automation services that provide home monitoring services and the ability to manage other functions within the home,
	such as lighting and room temperature, through our online portal or our mobile apps.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Technology
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our cable distribution system uses a hybrid fiber-optic and coaxial cable network that we believe is sufficiently flexible and scalable to support
	our future technology requirements. This network provides the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	two-way
</FONT>
	transmissions that are essential to providing high-speed Internet services, interactive video services, such as On Demand, and voice
	services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We continue to focus on technology initiatives, including:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	developing and deploying next-generation media and content delivery platforms, such as our X1 platform and related cloud DVR technology, that use IP
	technology and our own cloud network servers to deliver video and advanced search capabilities, including through a voice-activated remote control, and allow access to certain third-party Internet applications
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	deploying wireless gateways to improve the performance of multiple
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	IP-enabled
</FONT>
	devices used at the same time within the
	home, provide faster Internet speeds and create an
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	in-home
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Wi-Fi
</FONT>
	network
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	expanding our network of residential, outdoor and business
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Wi-Fi
</FONT>
	hotspots
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	developing multiple tools to recapture bandwidth and optimize our network to allow for faster Internet speeds and capacity, including using advanced video
	encoding and digital compression technologies and DOCSIS innovations, such as DOCSIS 3.1
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D290430D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	developing and deploying various technology and software tools to improve the customer experience
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Sources of Supply
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	To offer our video services, we license a substantial portion of our programming from cable networks and broadcast networks, as well as from local broadcast television stations. We attempt to secure long-term
	programming distribution agreements with these programming providers. We seek to include in our distribution agreements the rights to offer such programming through multiple delivery platforms that may be used in a variety of locations, such as
	through On Demand, our online portal, our mobile apps, and our streaming services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	For our high-speed Internet services, we license
	software products, such as email and security software, and content, such as news feeds for our online portal, from a variety of suppliers. Under our contracts with these suppliers, we generally pay on a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	fixed-fee
</FONT>
	basis, on a per subscriber basis in the case of software product licenses or on a video advertising revenue share basis in the case of content licenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	For our voice services, we license software products such as voicemail and text messaging from a variety of suppliers under multiyear contracts.
	The fees we pay are generally based on the consumption of the related services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We purchase from a limited number of suppliers a
	significant number of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	set-top
</FONT>
	boxes and certain other customer premise equipment, network equipment and services to provide our cable services and our home security and automation services to residential and
	business customers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We use two primary vendors to provide customer billing for our cable services to our residential and business
	customers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Customer and Technical Services
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our customer service call centers provide 24/7 call-answering capability, telemarketing and other services. Our technical services group performs various tasks, including installations, plant maintenance and
	upgrades to our cable distribution system.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Sales and Marketing
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We offer our services directly to residential and business customers through customer service call centers, customer service centers, our website,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	door-to-door
</FONT>
</FONT>
	selling, telemarketing and retail outlets, as well as through advertising via direct mail, television and the Internet.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
<B>
	NBCUniversal Segments
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:4PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #0C6DFF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Cable Networks
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our Cable Networks segment
	consists of a diversified portfolio of national cable networks that provide a variety of entertainment, news and information, and sports content, our regional sports and news networks, our international cable networks, and our cable television
	studio production operations. We also own related digital media properties, which primarily include brand-aligned websites.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	Household data is based on The Nielsen Company&#146;s January reports, except for Universal HD, which is derived from information provided by multichannel
	video providers. Household data for 2016 is derived from information available during the period from November&nbsp;28, 2016 through December&nbsp;25, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	(b)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	In January 2017, we announced plans to convert the Esquire Network to an online-only format in 2017 and we ceased operations of the Cloo network.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our regional sports and news networks together serve more than 27&nbsp;million households across the United States,
	including key markets such as Baltimore/Washington, Boston, Chicago, Philadelphia, Portland, Sacramento and San Francisco.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We market
	and distribute our cable network programming in the United States and internationally to traditional and virtual multichannel video providers, as well as to subscription video on demand services, such as those offered by Amazon, Hulu and Netflix.
	These distributors may provide our content on television, including via video on demand services, online and through mobile apps.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our
	cable networks produce their own programs or acquire the rights to programming from third parties, including sports programming rights that are discussed below under the heading &#147;Broadcast Television.&#148; Our cable television studio
	production operations identify, develop and produce original content for our cable networks and third parties. We license this content to cable networks, broadcast networks and subscription video on demand services and it is sold on
	standard-definition DVDs and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Blu-ray
</FONT>
	discs (together, &#147;DVDs&#148;) and through digital distribution services such as iTunes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Broadcast Television
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our Broadcast Television segment operates the NBC and Telemundo broadcast
	networks, which together serve viewers and advertisers in all 50 states. Our Broadcast Television segment also includes our owned NBC and Telemundo local broadcast television stations, the NBC Universo national cable network, our broadcast
	television studio production operations, and related digital media properties.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D290430D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
	NBC Network
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The NBC network distributes entertainment, news and sports programming that reaches viewers in virtually all U.S. television households through more than 200 affiliated stations across the United States, including
	our 10 owned
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	NBC-affiliated
</FONT>
	local broadcast television stations. The NBC network&#146;s programming library consists of rights of varying nature to more than 100,000 episodes of popular television content,
	including current and classic titles, unscripted programming, sports, news, long-form and short-form programming, and locally produced programming from around the world. In addition, the NBC network owns related digital media properties, which
	primarily include brand-aligned websites.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The NBC network produces its own programs or acquires the rights to programming from third
	parties. NBCUniversal has various contractual commitments for the licensing of rights to multiyear programming, primarily sports programming. Our most significant sports programming commitments include the U.S. broadcast rights for the summer and
	winter Olympic Games through 2032 and agreements with the NFL to produce and broadcast a specified number of regular season and playoff games, including
<I>
	Thursday Night Football
</I>
	through the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	2017-18
</FONT>
	season,
<I>
	Sunday Night Football
</I>
	through the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	2022-23
</FONT>
	season and the 2018 and 2021 Super Bowl games. We also have U.S. broadcast rights to a specified number of NHL games through the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	2020-21
</FONT>
	season, English Premier League soccer through the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	2021-22
</FONT>
	season, certain NASCAR events through 2024 and certain PGA TOUR and other golf events through 2030.
	NBCUniversal&#146;s sports programming agreements also include the rights to distribute content on our national cable networks, including the NBC Sports Network and Golf Channel, on our regional sports networks, and online, including through our
	mobile apps.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our broadcast television studio production operations develop and produce original content, including scripted and
	unscripted programming series and talk shows. This original content is licensed to broadcast networks, cable networks and local broadcast television stations owned by us and third parties, as well as to subscription video on demand services, and it
	is sold on DVDs and through digital distribution services both in the United States and internationally. We also produce
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	first-run
</FONT>
	syndicated shows for local markets that are broadcast on local broadcast
	television stations in the United States on a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	market-by-market
</FONT>
</FONT>
	basis. We currently distribute some of our television programs after their initial broadcast, as well as
	older television programs from our library, to local broadcast television stations and cable networks in the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	off-network
</FONT>
	syndication market.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
<I>
	NBC Local Broadcast Television Stations
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, we owned and operated 10
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	NBC-affiliated
</FONT>
	local broadcast television stations
	that collectively reached approximately 31&nbsp;million U.S. television households, which represent approximately 27% of U.S. television households. In addition to broadcasting the NBC network&#146;s national programming, our local broadcast
	television stations produce news, sports, public affairs and other programming that addresses local needs and acquire syndicated programming from other sources. The table below presents a summary of the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	NBC-affiliated
</FONT>
	local broadcast television stations that we owned and operated as of December&nbsp;31, 2016.
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	NBC-affiliated
</FONT>
	local broadcast television station in the
	Boston market that reaches approximately 2&nbsp;million U.S. television households. Boston&#146;s general market rank is No.&nbsp;9, which represents approximately 2% of U.S. television households.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
	Telemundo
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Telemundo is a leading Hispanic media company that produces, acquires and distributes Spanish-language content in the United States and
	internationally. Telemundo&#146;s operations include the Telemundo network, its 17 owned local broadcast television stations and the NBC Universo national cable network.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Telemundo network is a leading Spanish-language broadcast network featuring original telenovelas, movies, news, specials and sporting events. Telemundo develops original programming primarily through its
	production studio and also acquires the rights to programming from third parties. It holds the Spanish-language U.S. broadcast rights to FIFA World Cup soccer through 2026 and the Spanish-language U.S. broadcast rights for certain NFL games that the
	NBC network will broadcast through the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	2022-23
</FONT>
	season.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
<I>
	Telemundo Local Broadcast Television Stations
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	As of December 31, 2016, Telemundo owned 17 local broadcast television stations, including 16 local broadcast television stations affiliated with
	the Telemundo network, which collectively reached approximately 59% of U.S. Hispanic television households as of December&nbsp;31, 2016, and an independent television station in Puerto Rico. The table below presents a summary of these local
	broadcast television stations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;

	(a)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	DMA served is defined by Nielsen Media Research as a geographic market for the sale of national spot and local advertising time.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	Hispanic market rank is based on the relative size of the DMA among approximately 15.1&nbsp;million U.S. Hispanic households based on Nielsen estimates for
	the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	2016-17
</FONT>
	season.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">

	(d)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	Operated by a third party that provides certain
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-network
</FONT>
	programming and operations services under a time brokerage
	agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Filmed Entertainment
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our Filmed Entertainment segment primarily produces, acquires, markets and distributes filmed entertainment worldwide, and it also develops, produces and licenses live stage plays.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We produce films both on our own and jointly with other studios or production companies, as well as with other entities. Our films are produced
	primarily under the Universal Pictures, Illumination and Focus Features names, and in August 2016, we acquired DreamWorks Animation. Our films are marketed and distributed worldwide primarily through our own marketing and distribution operations. We
	also acquire distribution rights to films produced by others, which may be limited to particular geographic regions, specific forms of media or certain periods of time. Our content includes theatrical films,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	direct-to-video
</FONT>
</FONT>
	movies and our film library, which is comprised of more than 5,000 movies in a variety of genres.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We have entered into, and may continue to enter into, film cofinancing arrangements with third parties, including both studio and nonstudio entities, to jointly finance or distribute certain of our film
	productions. These arrangements can take various forms, but in most cases involve the grant of an economic interest in a film to an investor. Investors generally assume the full risks and rewards of ownership proportionate to their ownership in the
	film.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="49%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>

<TD VALIGN="TOP" NOWRAP>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	Comcast 2016 Annual Report on Form 10-K
</FONT>

<A NAME="eolPage14"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D290430D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The majority of our produced and acquired films are initially distributed for exhibition in movie
	theaters. After their release in movie theaters, we sell and license our films through various methods. We distribute our films globally by selling them on DVDs to retail stores, rental kiosks and subscription by mail services and by selling them
	through digital distribution services and video on demand services provided by multichannel video providers, including our Cable Communications segment. We also license our films, including selections from our film library, to cable, broadcast and
	premium networks, to subscription video on demand services, and to video on demand and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	pay-per-view
</FONT>
</FONT>
	services. The number of films that we license through subscription
	video on demand services is increasing as consumers continue to seek additional ways to view our content.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Theme Parks
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our Theme Parks segment consists primarily of our Universal theme parks in Orlando, Florida and Hollywood, California and our 51% interest in
	Universal Studios Japan, which we acquired in November 2015. Universal Orlando includes two theme parks, Universal Studios Florida and Universal&#146;s Islands of Adventure, as well as Universal CityWalk Orlando, a dining, retail and entertainment
	complex. Universal Orlando also features
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	on-site
</FONT>
	themed hotels in which we own a noncontrolling interest. Our Universal theme park in Hollywood, California consists primarily of Universal Studios Hollywood, as
	well as Universal CityWalk Hollywood. We continue to expand our theme park business internationally, such as through our plans to develop a Universal Studios theme park in Beijing, China along with a consortium of Chinese state-owned companies. In
	addition, we license the right to use the Universal Studios brand name and other intellectual property, and also provide other services, to third parties that own and operate the Universal Studios Singapore theme park on Sentosa Island, Singapore.
	We also owned a water park, Wet &#145;n Wild in Orlando, Florida, which closed on December&nbsp;31, 2016, and are developing a new water park, Volcano Bay, in Orlando, Florida, that we plan to open in
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	mid-2017.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our Theme Parks segment licenses the right to use a substantial amount of
	intellectual property from third parties for its themed elements in rides, attractions and merchandising.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
<B>
	Competition
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:4PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #0C6DFF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	All of our businesses
	operate in intensely competitive, consumer-driven and rapidly changing environments and compete with a growing number of companies that provide a broad range of communications products and services, and entertainment, news and information products
	and services, to consumers. Technological changes are further intensifying and complicating the competitive landscape for all of our businesses by challenging existing business models and affecting consumer behavior.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Cable Communications
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Competition for our
	cable services consists primarily of direct broadcast satellite (&#147;DBS&#148;) providers, which have a national footprint and compete in all of our service areas, and phone companies with fiber-based networks, which overlap approximately 60% of
	our service areas and are continuing to expand the areas they serve. Many of these competitors offer features, pricing and packaging for these services, individually and in bundles, comparable to what we offer, and some of these traditional
	competitors also offer smaller online-only video packages. In 2015, AT&amp;T, one of our largest phone company competitors, acquired DIRECTV, the nation&#146;s largest DBS provider, which created an even larger competitor to our cable services and
	has enabled it to enhance its bundled offerings with video, high-speed Internet, and wireline and wireless phone services. AT&amp;T also announced in 2016 a proposed merger with Time Warner Inc., a media and entertainment company, which competes
	with our NBCUniversal businesses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Current and future wireless Internet services, such as 3G, 4G and 5G wireless broadband services and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Wi-Fi
</FONT>
	networks, may compete with our high-speed Internet services, and our voice services are facing increased competition as customers replace wireline phones with wireless phones and Internet-based phone services
	such as Skype.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="49%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
<B>
	11
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" NOWRAP ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	Comcast 2016 Annual Report on Form 10-K

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D290430D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	There also continue to be new companies, some with significant financial resources, that offer or are
	seeking to offer services that potentially may compete with some or all of our cable services. For example, Google has launched high-speed Internet and video services in a limited number of areas in which we operate and other companies continue to
	emerge that provide Internet streaming and downloading of video programming, some of which charge a nominal or no fee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
	Video Services
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We compete with a number of different sources that provide news, sports, information and entertainment programming to consumers,
	including:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	DBS providers, including AT&amp;T&#146;s DIRECTV and DISH Network, that transmit satellite signals to substantially all U.S. households to provide video
	programming and other information similar to our video services
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	phone companies, including AT&amp;T and Verizon, that have built and continue to build fiber-based networks that provide cable services similar to ours, which
	overlap a substantial portion of our service areas, and that in some cases offer bundled offerings that include wireless phone services
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	online video distributors that offer online services and devices that enable Internet streaming and downloading of movies, television shows and other video
	programming, including linear and video on demand programming, and generally involve the offering of smaller packages of programming networks at prices lower than our traditional video service package offerings
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	other providers that build and operate wireline communications systems in the same communities that we serve, including those operating as franchised cable
	operators
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	&nbsp;

</TD>

</TD>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	satellite master antenna television systems that offer to their subscribers both improved reception of local broadcast television stations and much of the
	programming offered by our cable systems and generally serve MDUs, office complexes and residential developments
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%">

	&nbsp;

</TD>

	&nbsp;

</FONT>

</FONT>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	other companies, such as local broadcast television stations, that provide multiple channels of free
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	over-the-air
</FONT>
</FONT>
	programming, as well as video rental services and home entertainment and gaming products
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%">

</FONT>
</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
	High-Speed Internet Services
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We compete with a number of companies offering Internet services, including:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Some phone companies, such as AT&amp;T, CenturyLink, Frontier and Verizon, have
	built and are continuing to build fiber-based network infrastructure farther into their networks, which allows them to provide data trans-

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D290430D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	mission speeds that exceed those that can be provided with traditional digital subscriber line (&#147;DSL&#148;) technology, and are now offering these higher-speed services in many of our
	service areas. Certain companies that offer DSL service have increased data transmission speeds, lowered prices or created bundled services to compete with our high-speed Internet services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Google has launched a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	fiber-to-the-home
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
	network that provides high-speed Internet services in a limited number of areas in which we operate, and
	certain municipalities in our service areas are also building fiber-based networks.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Various wireless companies are offering Internet
	services using a variety of network types, including 3G and 4G, and in the future 5G, wireless broadband services and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Wi-Fi
</FONT>
	networks. These networks work with devices such as smartphones, laptops, tablets and
	mobile wireless routers, as well as wireless data cards. A growing number of commercial venues, such as retail malls, restaurants and airports, also offer
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Wi-Fi
</FONT>
	service. Numerous local governments are also
	considering or actively pursuing publicly subsidized
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Wi-Fi
</FONT>
	and other Internet access networks. The availability of these wireless offerings could negatively impact the demand for our high-speed Internet
	services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
	Voice Services
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our voice services compete with wireline and wireless phone companies, including incumbent local exchange carriers (&#147;ILECs&#148;) and
	competitive local exchange carriers (&#147;CLECs&#148;), and other Internet-based and VoIP service providers. Certain phone companies, such as the ILECs AT&amp;T and Verizon, have substantial capital and other resources, longstanding customer
	relationships, and extensive existing facilities and network
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	rights-of-way.
</FONT>
</FONT>
	A few CLECs also have existing local networks and significant financial resources. In
	addition, we are increasingly competing with other phone service providers as customers replace traditional wireline phone services with wireless and Internet-based phone services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
	Business Services
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our business services primarily compete with a variety of phone
	companies, including ILECs and CLECs. These companies either operate their own network infrastructure or rely on reselling all or part of another carrier&#146;s network. We also compete with satellite operators who offer video services to
	businesses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	NBCUniversal Segments
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
	Cable Networks and Broadcast Television
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our cable networks, broadcast networks and owned local broadcast television stations compete for viewers&#146; attention and audience share with all forms of programming provided to viewers, including cable,
	broadcast and premium networks; subscription video on demand services; local broadcast television stations; home entertainment products;
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	pay-per-view
</FONT>
</FONT>
	and video on demand
	services; online activities, such as social networking and viewing user-generated content; gaming products; and other forms of entertainment, news and information.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our cable networks, broadcast networks and owned local broadcast television stations compete for the acquisition of programming and for
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	on-air
</FONT>
	and creative talent with other
	cable and broadcast networks, local television stations and subscription video on demand services. The market for programming is very competitive, particularly for sports programming, where the cost for such programming is significant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our cable networks compete with other cable networks and programming providers for carriage of their programming by multichannel video providers
	and subscription video on demand services. Our broadcast networks compete with the other broadcast networks in markets across the United States to secure affiliations with independently owned television stations, which are necessary to ensure the
	effective distribution of broadcast network programming to a nationwide audience.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="49%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
<B>
	13
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>

<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
