</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Finite-lived intangible assets are subject to amortization and consist primarily of customer relationships acquired
	in business combinations, software, cable franchise renewal costs, contractual operating rights and intellectual property rights. Our finite-lived intangible assets are amortized primarily on a straight-line basis over their estimated useful life or
	the term of the associated agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We capitalize direct development costs associated with
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	internal-use
</FONT>
	software, including external direct costs of material and services and payroll costs for employees devoting time to these software projects. We also capitalize costs associated with the purchase
	of software licenses. We include these costs in other intangible assets and generally amortize them on a straight-line basis over a period not to exceed five years. We expense maintenance and training costs, as well as costs incurred during the
	preliminary stage of a project, as they are incurred. We capitalize initial operating system software costs and amortize them over the life of the associated hardware.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We evaluate the recoverability of our finite-lived intangible assets whenever events or substantive changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount may not be recoverable. The evaluation is based on the
	cash flows generated by the underlying asset groups, including estimated future operating results, trends or other determinants of fair value. If the total of the expected future undiscounted cash flows were less than the carrying amount of the
	asset group, we would recognize an impairment charge to the extent the carrying amount of the asset group exceeded its estimated fair value. Unless presented separately, the impairment charge is included as a component of amortization expense.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_42"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

	Table of Contents

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Comcast Corporation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	(a)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	The December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015 amounts consist of &yen;382&nbsp;billion and &yen;400&nbsp;billion, respectively, of Universal Studios Japan term loans
	translated using the exchange rates as of these dates.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	(b)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	The December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015 amounts include &pound;625&nbsp;million of 5.50% notes due 2029, which translated to $771&nbsp;million and
	$921&nbsp;million, respectively, using the exchange rates as of these dates.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	(c)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	Includes the effects of our derivative financial instruments.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, our debt had an estimated fair value of $66.3&nbsp;billion and $58.0&nbsp;billion, respectively. The estimated fair value of our publicly traded debt is primarily based on
	Level&nbsp;1 inputs that use quoted market values for the debt. The estimated fair value of debt for which there are no quoted market prices is based on Level&nbsp;2 inputs that use interest rates available to us for debt with similar terms and
	remaining maturities. See Note 19 for additional information on our cross-guarantee structure.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Debt Instruments
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
	Revolving Bank Credit Facilities
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In May 2016, we entered into a new $7&nbsp;billion
	revolving credit facility due 2021 with a syndicate of banks (&#147;Comcast revolving credit facility&#148;) that may be used for general corporate purposes. We may increase the commitment under the Comcast revolving credit facility up to a total of
	$10&nbsp;billion, as well as extend the
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="CENTER">

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" NOWRAP>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	Comcast 2016 Annual Report on Form 10-K
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
<B>
	98
</B>

<A NAME="eolPage102"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D290430D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Comcast Corporation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	expiration date to a date no later than 2023, subject to approval of the lenders. In addition, NBCUniversal Enterprise entered into a new
	$1.5&nbsp;billion revolving credit facility due 2021 with a syndicate of banks (&#147;NBCUniversal Enterprise revolving credit facility&#148;) that may be used for general corporate purposes. We may increase the commitment under the NBCUniversal
	Enterprise revolving credit facility up to a total of $2&nbsp;billion, as well as extend the expiration date to a date no later than 2023, subject to approval of the lenders. The new revolving credit facilities replaced Comcast&#146;s
	$6.25&nbsp;billion and NBCUniversal Enterprise&#146;s $1.35&nbsp;billion revolving credit facilities, which were terminated in connection with the execution of the new revolving credit facilities. The interest rates on the new revolving credit
	facilities consist of a base rate plus a borrowing margin that is determined based on Comcast&#146;s credit rating. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, the borrowing margin for borrowings based on the London Interbank Offered Rate was 1.00%. Similar to
	the Comcast and NBCUniversal Enterprise prior revolving credit facilities, each of the new revolving credit facilities require that we maintain certain financial ratios based on their respective debt and operating income before depreciation and
	amortization, as defined in the credit facility. We were in compliance with all financial covenants for all periods presented.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	As of
	December&nbsp;31, 2016, amounts available under our consolidated credit facilities, net of amounts outstanding under our commercial paper programs and outstanding letters of credit, totaled $5.5&nbsp;billion, which included $460&nbsp;million
	available under the NBCUniversal Enterprise revolving credit facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
	Commercial Paper Programs
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our commercial paper programs provide a lower-cost source of borrowing to fund our short-term working capital requirements. The maximum borrowing
	capacity under the Comcast commercial paper program is $6.25&nbsp;billion. We support this commercial paper program with unused capacity under the Comcast revolving credit facility. The maximum borrowing capacity under the NBCUniversal Enterprise
	commercial paper program is $1.35&nbsp;billion. We support this commercial paper program with unused capacity under the NBCUniversal Enterprise revolving credit facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
	Term Loans
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our term loans consist of the Universal Studios Japan term loans, which
	have a final maturity of November 2020. These term loans contain financial and operating covenants and are secured by the assets of Universal Studios Japan and the equity interests of the other investors. We do not guarantee these term loans and
	they are otherwise nonrecourse to us.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
	Letters of Credit
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, we and certain of our subsidiaries had unused irrevocable standby letters of credit totaling $443&nbsp;million to cover potential fundings under various agreements.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_46"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We sponsor various benefit plans that provide postretirement benefits to eligible employees based on years of
	service. The Comcast Postretirement Healthcare Stipend Program (the &#147;stipend plan&#148;) provides an annual stipend for
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="49%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
<B>
	99
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<A NAME="eolPage103"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D290430D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Comcast Corporation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	reimbursement of healthcare costs to each eligible employee based on years of service. Under the stipend plan, we are not exposed to the increasing
	costs of healthcare because the benefits are fixed at a predetermined amount. In December 2016, the stipend plan was amended primarily to reduce the benefits of active employees who retire after December&nbsp;31, 2017. The plan amendments reduced
	our benefit obligation in 2016 by $361&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	NBCUniversal&#146;s postretirement medical and life insurance plans provide
	continuous coverage to employees eligible to receive such benefits. A small number of eligible employees also participate in legacy plans of acquired companies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	All of our postretirement benefit plans are unfunded and substantially all of our postretirement benefit obligations are recorded to noncurrent liabilities. The expense we recognize for our postretirement benefit
	plans is determined using certain assumptions, including the discount rate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Pension Plans
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	NBCUniversal sponsors various qualified and nonqualified defined benefit pension plans for domestic employees. Since the future benefits have been
	frozen since the beginning of 2013, we did not recognize service costs related to the pension plans for all periods presented. The benefits expense we recognized for our defined benefit plans was not material for all periods presented. In addition
	to the defined benefit plans it sponsors, NBCUniversal is also obligated to reimburse General Electric (&#147;GE&#148;) for future benefit payments to those participants who were vested in the supplemental pension plan sponsored by GE at the time of
	the NBCUniversal transaction in 2011. These pension plans are currently unfunded and we recorded a benefit obligation of $314&nbsp;million and $309&nbsp;million as of December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, respectively, which consists primarily of our
	obligations to reimburse GE.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Other Employee Benefits
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
	Deferred Compensation Plans
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We maintain unfunded, nonqualified deferred compensation
	plans for certain members of management and nonemployee directors (each, a &#147;participant&#148;). The amount of compensation deferred by each participant is based on participant elections. Participant accounts, except for those in the
	NBCUniversal plan, are credited with income primarily based on a fixed annual rate. Participants in the NBCUniversal plan designate one or more valuation funds, independently established funds or indices that are used to determine the amount of
	investment gain or loss in the participant&#146;s account. Participants are eligible to receive distributions from their account based on elected deferral periods that are consistent with the plans and applicable tax law.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The table below presents the benefit obligation and interest expense for our deferred compensation plans.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We have purchased life insurance policies to recover a portion of the future payments related to our deferred
	compensation plans. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, the cash surrender value of these policies, which is recorded to other noncurrent assets, was $709&nbsp;million and $658&nbsp;million, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
	Retirement Investment Plans
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We
	sponsor several 401(k) defined contribution retirement plans that allow eligible employees to contribute a portion of their compensation through payroll deductions in accordance with specified plan guidelines. We make contributions to the plans that
	include matching a percentage of the employees&#146; contributions up to certain limits. In 2016, 2015 and 2014, expenses related to these plans totaled $446&nbsp;million, $416&nbsp;million and $379&nbsp;million, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D290430D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Comcast Corporation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
	Multiemployer Benefit Plans
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We
	participate in various multiemployer benefit plans, including pension and postretirement benefit plans, that cover some of our employees and temporary employees who are represented by labor unions. We also participate in other multiemployer benefit
	plans that provide health and welfare and retirement savings benefits to active and retired participants. We make periodic contributions to these plans in accordance with the terms of applicable collective bargaining agreements and laws but do not
	sponsor or administer these plans. We do not participate in any multiemployer benefit plans for which we consider our contributions to be individually significant, and the largest plans in which we participate are funded at a level of 80% or
	greater.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In 2016, 2015 and 2014, the total contributions we made to multiemployer pension plans were $84&nbsp;million, $77&nbsp;million
	and $58&nbsp;million, respectively. In 2016, 2015 and 2014, the total contributions we made to multiemployer postretirement and other benefit plans were $136&nbsp;million, $119&nbsp;million and $125&nbsp;million, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	If we cease to be obligated to make contributions or were to otherwise withdraw from participation in any of these plans, applicable law would
	require us to fund our allocable share of the unfunded vested benefits, which is known as a withdrawal liability. In addition, actions taken by other participating employers may lead to adverse changes in the financial condition of one of these
	plans, which could result in an increase in our withdrawal liability.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
	Severance Benefits
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We provide severance benefits to certain former employees. A liability is recorded when payment is probable, the amount is reasonably estimable, and
	the obligation relates to rights that have vested or accumulated. In 2016, 2015 and 2014, we recorded severance costs of $315&nbsp;million, $181&nbsp;million and $152&nbsp;million, respectively. Severance costs in 2016 included $61&nbsp;million of
	severance costs associated with the acquisition of DreamWorks Animation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
<B>
	Note 12: Equity
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:4PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #0C6DFF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Common Stock
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX; " ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In the aggregate, holders of our Class&nbsp;A common stock have 66
<FONT SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	&nbsp;2
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	/
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1">
<SUB STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; TOP:.1EX">
	3
</SUB>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	% of
	the voting power of our common stock and holders of our Class&nbsp;B common stock have 33
<FONT SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	&nbsp;1
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	/
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1">
<SUB STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; TOP:.1EX">
	3
</SUB>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	% of the voting power of our common stock. Each share of our Class&nbsp;B common stock is entitled to 15 votes. The number of votes
	held by each share of our Class&nbsp;A common stock depends on the number of shares of Class&nbsp;A and Class&nbsp;B common stock outstanding at any given time. The
	33
<FONT SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	&nbsp;1
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	/
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1">
<SUB STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; TOP:.1EX">
	3
</SUB>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	% aggregate voting power of our Class&nbsp;B common stock cannot be diluted by additional issuances of any other class of common stock. Our Class&nbsp;B common stock is convertible, share for share, into
	Class&nbsp;A common stock, subject to certain restrictions.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Class&nbsp;A Special Common Stock Reclassification
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In December 2015, our shareholders approved a proposal to amend and restate our Amended and Restated Certificate of Incorporation in order to
	reclassify each issued share of our Class&nbsp;A Special common stock into one share of our Class&nbsp;A common stock. This reclassification became effective as of the close of business on December&nbsp;11, 2015, at which time our Class&nbsp;A
	Special common stock was no longer outstanding and ceased trading on the NASDAQ under the symbol CMCSK and instead became listed on the NASDAQ under the symbol CMCSA. There was no impact on basic and diluted EPS or the carrying value of total common
	stock as presented in our consolidated balance sheet because it was a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	one-for-one
</FONT>
</FONT>
	stock exchange.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
	Share Repurchases
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Effective January&nbsp;1, 2017, our Board of Directors increased our share repurchase program authorization to a total of $12&nbsp;billion, which does not have an expiration date. Under the authorization, we may
	repurchase shares in the open market or in private transactions.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D290430D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Comcast Corporation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, we had unrecognized pretax compensation expense of $712&nbsp;million related to nonvested RSUs and unrecognized pretax
	compensation expense of $375&nbsp;million related to nonvested stock options that will be recognized over a weighted-average period of approximately 1.7 years and 1.8 years, respectively. In 2016, 2015 and 2014, we recorded increases to additional
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	paid-in
</FONT>
	capital of $233&nbsp;million, $311&nbsp;million and $299&nbsp;million, respectively, which were the result of tax benefits associated with our share-based compensation plans.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_52"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
	Stock Options and Restricted Share Units
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="93%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, unless otherwise stated (in millions, except per share data)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" COLSPAN="2" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	Stock
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PX" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	Options
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;

</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, substantially all of our stock options outstanding were net settled stock options.
	Net settled stock options, as opposed to stock options exercised with a cash payment, result in fewer shares being issued and no cash proceeds being received by us when the options are exercised. Our share-based compensation primarily consists of
	awards of RSUs and stock options to certain employees and directors as part of our approach to long-term incentive compensation. Awards generally vest over a period of 5 years and in the case of stock options, have a 10 year term. Additionally,
	through our employee stock purchase plans, employees are able to purchase shares of Comcast common stock at a discount through payroll deductions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The cost associated with our share-based compensation is based on an award&#146;s estimated fair value at the date of grant and is recognized over the period in which any related services are provided. RSUs are
	valued based on the closing price of our common stock on the date of grant and are discounted for the lack of dividends, if any, during the vesting period. We use the Black-Scholes option pricing model to estimate the fair value of stock option
	awards. The table below presents the weighted-average fair value on the date of grant of RSUs and stock options awarded under our various plans and the related weighted-average valuation assumptions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	(114
</FONT>

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">

	)&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #0C6DFF">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Income tax expense
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #0C6DFF">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #0C6DFF">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	$
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #0C6DFF" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	5,308
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #0C6DFF">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #0C6DFF">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #0C6DFF">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	$
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #0C6DFF" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	4,959
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #0C6DFF">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #0C6DFF">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #0C6DFF">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	$
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #0C6DFF" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	3,873
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #0C6DFF">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We base our provision for income taxes on our current period income, changes in our deferred income tax assets and
	liabilities, income tax rates, changes in estimates of our uncertain tax positions, and tax planning opportunities available in the jurisdictions in which we operate. We recognize deferred tax assets and liabilities when there are temporary
	differences between the financial reporting basis and tax basis of our assets and liabilities and for the expected benefits of using net operating loss carryforwards. When a change in the tax rate or tax law has an impact on deferred taxes, we apply
	the change based on the years in which the temporary differences are expected to reverse. We record the change in our consolidated financial statements in the period of enactment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The determination of the income tax consequences of a business combination includes identifying the tax basis of assets and liabilities acquired
	and any contingencies associated with uncertain tax positions assumed or resulting from the business combination. Deferred tax assets and liabilities related to temporary differences of an acquired entity are recorded as of the date of the business
	combination and are based on our estimate of the ultimate tax basis that will be accepted by the various tax authorities. We record liabilities for contingencies associated with prior tax returns filed by the acquired entity based on criteria set
	forth in the appropriate accounting guidance. We adjust the deferred tax accounts and the liabilities periodically to reflect any revised estimated tax basis and any estimated settlements with the various tax authorities. The effects of these
	adjustments are recorded to income tax expense.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	Comcast 2016 Annual Report on Form 10-K
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">

<A NAME="eolPage108"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D290430D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Comcast Corporation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	From time to time, we engage in transactions in which the tax consequences may be subject to uncertainty. In these cases, we evaluate our tax
	position using the recognition threshold and the measurement attribute in accordance with the accounting guidance related to uncertain tax positions. Examples of these transactions include business acquisitions and dispositions, including
	consideration paid or received in connection with these transactions, certain financing transactions, and the allocation of income among state and local tax jurisdictions. Significant judgment is required in assessing and estimating the tax
	consequences of these transactions. We determine whether it is more likely than not that a tax position will be sustained on examination, including the resolution of any related appeals or litigation processes, based on the technical merits of the
	position. A tax position that meets the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	more-likely-than-not
</FONT>
	recognition threshold is measured to determine the amount of benefit to be recognized in our consolidated financial statements. We classify interest
	and penalties, if any, associated with our uncertain tax positions as a component of income tax expense.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	NBCUniversal
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	For U.S. federal income tax purposes, NBCUniversal Holdings is treated as a partnership and NBCUniversal is disregarded as an entity separate from
	NBCUniversal Holdings. Accordingly, for U.S. federal and state income tax purposes, the income of NBCUniversal Holdings and NBCUniversal is included in tax returns filed by us and our subsidiaries. Therefore, neither NBCUniversal Holdings nor
	NBCUniversal and its subsidiaries incur any material current or deferred domestic income taxes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We are indemnified by GE for any income
	tax liability attributable to the NBCUniversal contributed businesses for periods prior to the close of the NBCUniversal transaction in January 2011 and also for any income tax liability attributable to NBCUniversal Enterprise for periods prior to
	the date of the NBCUniversal redemption transaction in March 2013. We have indemnified GE for any income tax liability attributable to the businesses we contributed to NBCUniversal for periods prior to the close of the NBCUniversal transaction.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Current and deferred foreign income taxes are incurred by NBCUniversal&#146;s foreign subsidiaries. In 2016, 2015 and 2014,
	NBCUniversal had foreign income before taxes of $871&nbsp;million, $704&nbsp;million and $385&nbsp;million, respectively, on which foreign income tax expense was recorded. We recorded U.S. income tax expense on our allocable share of our
	subsidiaries&#146; income before domestic and foreign taxes, which was reduced by a U.S. tax credit equal to our allocable share of our subsidiaries&#146; foreign income tax expense.
</FONT>
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage109"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D290430D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Comcast Corporation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Changes in our net deferred tax liability in 2016 that were not recorded as deferred income tax expense are primarily related to an increase of
	$158&nbsp;million associated with items included in other comprehensive income (loss), a decrease of $226&nbsp;million related to acquisitions and a decrease of $129&nbsp;million associated with our purchase of a noncontrolling interest. Our net
	deferred tax liability includes $23&nbsp;billion related to cable franchise rights that will remain unchanged unless we recognize an impairment or dispose of a cable franchise or there is a change in the tax law.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, we had federal net operating loss carryforwards of $598&nbsp;million, including losses of DreamWorks Animation, and
	various state net operating loss carryforwards that expire in periods through 2036. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, we also had foreign net operating loss carryforwards of $431&nbsp;million that are related to the foreign operations of NBCUniversal,
	the majority of which expire in periods through 2026. The determination of the realization of the state and foreign net operating loss carryforwards is dependent on our subsidiaries&#146; taxable income or loss, apportionment percentages,
	redetermination from taxing authorities, and state and foreign laws that can change from year to year and impact the amount of such carryforwards. We recognize a valuation allowance if we determine it is more likely than not that some portion, or
	all, of a deferred tax asset will not be realized. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, our valuation allowance was primarily related to state and foreign net operating loss carryforwards.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Uncertain Tax Positions
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our uncertain tax positions as of December&nbsp;31, 2016 totaled
	$1.1&nbsp;billion, which exclude the federal benefits on state tax positions that were recorded as deferred income taxes. Included in our uncertain tax positions was $181&nbsp;million related to tax positions of NBCUniversal and NBCUniversal
	Enterprise for which we have been indemnified by GE. If we were to recognize the tax benefit for our uncertain tax positions in the future, $600&nbsp;million would impact our effective tax rate and the remaining amount would increase our deferred
	income tax liability. The amount and timing of the recognition of any such tax benefit is dependent on the completion of examinations of our tax filings by the various tax authorities and the expiration of statutes of limitations. In 2014, we
	reduced our accruals for uncertain tax positions and the related accrued interest on these tax positions and, as a result, our income tax expense decreased by $759&nbsp;million. It is reasonably possible that certain tax contests could be resolved
	within the next 12 months that may result in a decrease in our effective tax rate.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, our accrued interest associated with uncertain tax positions was
	$483&nbsp;million and $510&nbsp;million, respectively. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, $39&nbsp;million and $49&nbsp;million, respectively, of these amounts were related to tax positions of NBCUniversal and NBCUniversal Enterprise for which
	we have been indemnified by GE.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	During 2016, the IRS completed its examination of our income tax returns for the year 2014. Various
	states are examining our tax returns, with most of the periods relating to tax years 2000 and forward. The tax years of our state tax returns currently under examination vary by state.
</FONT>

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D290430D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Comcast Corporation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
<B>
	Note 16: Commitments and Contingencies
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:4PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #0C6DFF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Commitments
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	NBCUniversal enters into long-term commitments with third parties in the ordinary course of its business, including commitments to acquire film and
	television programming, obligations under various creative talent agreements, and various other television-related commitments. Many of NBCUniversal&#146;s employees, including writers, directors, actors, technical and production personnel, and
	others, as well as some of its
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	on-air
</FONT>
	and creative talent, are covered by collective bargaining agreements or works councils. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, the total number of NBCUniversal full-time, part-time
	and hourly employees on its payroll covered by collective bargaining agreements was 8,500 full-time equivalent employees. Approximately 15% of these full-time equivalent employees were covered by collective bargaining agreements that have expired or
	are scheduled to expire during 2017.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We, through Comcast Spectacor, have employment agreements with both players and coaches of the
	Philadelphia Flyers. Certain of these employment agreements, which provide for payments that are guaranteed regardless of employee injury or termination, are covered by disability insurance if certain conditions are met.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The table below summarizes our minimum annual programming and talent commitments and our minimum annual rental commitments for office space,
	equipment and transponder service agreements under operating leases. Programming and talent commitments include acquired film and television programming, including U.S. broadcast rights to the Olympic Games through 2032,
<I>
	Sunday Night Football
</I>
	through the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	2022-23
</FONT>
	season,
<I>
	Thursday Night Football
</I>
	through the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	2017-18
</FONT>
	season, certain NASCAR events through 2024 and other programming commitments, as well as
	various contracts with creative talent.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_60"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="93%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2016 (in millions)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Contractual Obligation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We are party to a contractual obligation that involves an interest held by a third party in the revenue of certain theme parks. The arrangement provides the counterparty with the right to periodic payments
	associated with current period revenue and, beginning in June 2017, the option to require NBCUniversal to purchase the interest for cash in an amount based on a contractual formula. The contractual formula is based on an average of specified
	historical theme park revenue at the time of exercise, which amount could be significantly higher than our carrying value. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, our carrying value was $1.1&nbsp;billion, and if the option had been exercisable as of
	December&nbsp;31, 2016, the estimated value of the contractual obligation would have been approximately $1.4&nbsp;billion, based on inputs to the contractual formula as of that date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Contingent Consideration
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In June 2015, we settled a contingent consideration liability related
	to the acquisition of NBCUniversal, which was based upon future net tax benefits realized by us that would affect future payments to GE, for a payment
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>

	Comcast 2016 Annual Report on Form 10-K

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D290430D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Comcast Corporation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	of $450&nbsp;million, which is included as a financing activity in our consolidated statement of cash flows. The settlement resulted in a gain of
	$240&nbsp;million, which was recorded to other income (expense), net in our consolidated statement of income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Redeemable Subsidiary Preferred Stock
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	NBCUniversal Enterprise is a holding company that we control and consolidate whose principal assets are its interests in
	NBCUniversal Holdings. The NBCUniversal Enterprise preferred stock pays dividends at a fixed rate of 5.25%&nbsp;per annum. The holders have the right to cause NBCUniversal Enterprise to redeem their shares at a price equal to the liquidation
	preference plus accrued but unpaid dividends for a 30 day period beginning on March&nbsp;19, 2020 and thereafter on every third anniversary of such date (each such date, a &#147;put date&#148;). Shares of preferred stock can be called for redemption
	by NBCUniversal Enterprise at a price equal to the liquidation preference plus accrued but unpaid dividends one year following the put date applicable to such shares. Because certain of these redemption provisions are outside of our control, the
	NBCUniversal Enterprise preferred stock is presented outside of equity under the caption &#147;redeemable noncontrolling interests and redeemable subsidiary preferred stock&#148; in our consolidated balance sheet. Its initial value was based on the
	liquidation preference of the preferred stock and is adjusted for accrued but unpaid dividends. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, the fair value of the NBCUniversal Enterprise redeemable subsidiary preferred stock was $741&nbsp;million and
	$758&nbsp;million, respectively. The estimated fair values are based on Level&nbsp;2 inputs that use pricing models whose inputs are derived primarily from or corroborated by observable market data through correlation or other means for
	substantially the full term of the financial instrument.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Contingencies
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We are a defendant in several unrelated lawsuits claiming infringement of various patents relating to various aspects of our businesses. In certain of these cases other industry participants are also defendants,
	and also in certain of these cases we expect that any potential liability would be in part or in whole the responsibility of our equipment and technology vendors under applicable contractual indemnification provisions. We are also subject to other
	legal proceedings and claims that arise in the ordinary course of our business. While the amount of ultimate liability with respect to such actions is not expected to materially affect our results of operations, cash flows or financial position, any
	litigation resulting from any such legal proceedings or claims could be time-consuming and injure our reputation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
<B>
	Note 17: Financial Data by Business Segment
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:4PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #0C6DFF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We present our operations in one reportable
	business segment for Cable Communications and four reportable business segments for NBCUniversal. The Cable Networks, Broadcast Television, Filmed Entertainment and Theme Parks segments comprise the NBCUniversal businesses and are collectively
	referred to as the NBCUniversal segments. Our financial data by reportable business segment is presented in the tables below.&nbsp;We do not present a measure of total assets for our reportable business segments as this information is not used by
	management to allocate resources and capital.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	Subscription revenue received from customers who purchase bundled services at a discounted rate is allocated proportionally to each service based on the
	individual service&#146;s price on a stand-alone basis.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	For each of 2016, 2015 and 2014, 2.8% of Cable Communications revenue was derived from franchise and other regulatory fees.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	(b)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	Beginning in 2016, certain operations and businesses, including several strategic business initiatives, that were previously presented in Corporate and Other
	are now presented in our Cable Communications segment to reflect a change in our management reporting presentation. For segment reporting purposes, we have adjusted all periods presented to reflect this change.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;

	(c)
</FONT>

<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	The revenue and operating costs and expenses associated with our broadcast of the 2016 Rio Olympics and 2014 Sochi Olympics were reported in our Cable
	Networks and Broadcast Television segments. The revenue and operating costs and expenses associated with our broadcast of the 2015 Super Bowl were reported in our Broadcast Television segment.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

</TABLE>

</FONT>

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	our Cable Networks segment generates revenue by selling programming to our Cable Communications segment, which represents a substantial majority of the
	revenue elimination amount
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>

	$4.4&nbsp;billion, respectively. No single customer accounted for a significant amount of revenue in any period.

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	We use operating income (loss) before depreciation and amortization, excluding impairment charges related to fixed and intangible assets and gains or losses
	from the sale of assets, if any, as the measure of profit or loss for our operating segments. This measure eliminates the significant level of noncash depreciation and amortization expense that results from the capital-intensive nature of certain of
	our busi-

<A HREF="#D290430D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Comcast Corporation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	nesses and from intangible assets recognized in business combinations. Additionally, it is unaffected by our capital structure or investment activities. We
	use this measure to evaluate our consolidated operating performance and the operating performance of our operating segments and to allocate resources and capital to our operating segments. It is also a significant performance measure in our annual
	incentive compensation programs. We believe that this measure is useful to investors because it is one of the bases for comparing our operating performance with that of other companies in our industries, although our measure may not be directly
	comparable to similar measures used by other companies. This measure should not be considered a substitute for operating income (loss), net income (loss) attributable to Comcast Corporation, net cash provided by operating activities, or other
	measures of performance or liquidity we have reported in accordance with GAAP.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	(a)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	In the fourth quarter of 2016, net income attributable to Comcast Corporation included $225&nbsp;million, $143&nbsp;million net of tax, recognized in
	connection with the settlement of amounts owed to us under an agency agreement that had provided for, among other things, Verizon Wireless&#146; sale of our cable services.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
<B>
	Note 19: Condensed Consolidating Financial Information
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:4PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #0C6DFF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:7PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Comcast (&#147;Comcast Parent&#148;), Comcast Cable Communications, LLC (&#147;CCCL Parent&#148;) and NBCUniversal (&#147;NBCUniversal Media
	Parent&#148;) have fully and unconditionally guaranteed each other&#146;s debt securities, including the Comcast revolving credit facility. The principal amount of debt securities within the guarantee structure total $52.9&nbsp;billion, of which
	$12.3&nbsp;billion will mature within the next five years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Comcast Parent and CCCL Parent also fully and unconditionally guarantee
	NBCUniversal Enterprise&#146;s $3.3&nbsp;billion principal amount of senior notes, revolving credit facility and commercial paper program. NBCUniversal Media Parent does not guarantee the NBCUniversal Enterprise senior notes, revolving credit
	facility or commercial paper program.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Comcast Parent provides an unconditional subordinated guarantee of the $185&nbsp;million
	principal amount currently outstanding of Comcast Holdings&#146; ZONES due October 2029. Neither CCCL Parent nor NBCUniversal Media Parent guarantee the Comcast Holdings&#146; ZONES due October 2029. None of Comcast Parent, CCCL Parent nor
	NBCUniversal Media Parent guarantee the $62&nbsp;million principal amount currently outstanding of Comcast Holdings&#146; ZONES due November 2029 or the $3.3&nbsp;billion of Universal Studios Japan term loans.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_ACCOUNTING_CHANGES>
<A NAME="FIS_ACCOUNTING_CHANGES"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="4" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
<A NAME="D290430D10K_HTM_TOC290430_12">
</A>
	Item&nbsp;9: Changes in and Disagreements with Accountants on Accounting
	and Financial Disclosure
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	None.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_ACCOUNTING_CHANGES>
<EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<A NAME="FIS_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="4" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
<A NAME="D290430D10K_HTM_TOC290430_13">
</A>
	Item&nbsp;9A: Controls and Procedures
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
<B>
	Comcast
	Corporation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:4PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #0C6DFF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Conclusions regarding
	disclosure controls and procedures
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:2PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our principal executive and principal financial officers, after evaluating the effectiveness of
	Comcast&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	13a-15(e)
</FONT>
	and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	15d-15(e))
</FONT>
	as of the end of the period covered by this report, have
	concluded that, based on the evaluation of these controls and procedures required by paragraph (b)&nbsp;of Exchange Act Rules
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	13a-15
</FONT>
	or
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	15d-15,
</FONT>
	Comcast&#146;s disclosure
	controls and procedures were effective.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Management&#146;s annual report on internal control over financial reporting
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:2PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Refer to Management&#146;s Report on Comcast&#146;s Internal Control Over Financial Reporting on page 73.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Attestation report of the registered public accounting firm
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:2PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Refer to Report of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm on page 74.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Changes in internal control over
	financial reporting
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:2PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	As a result of our acquisition of DreamWorks Animation on August&nbsp;22, 2016, our internal control over
	financial reporting, subsequent to the date of acquisition, includes certain additional internal controls relating to DreamWorks Animation. Except as described above, there were no changes in Comcast&#146;s internal control over financial reporting
	identified in connection with the evaluation required by paragraph (d)&nbsp;of Exchange Act Rules
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	13a-15
</FONT>
	or
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	15d-15
</FONT>
	that occurred during our last fiscal quarter that have
	materially affected, or are reasonably likely to materially affect, Comcast&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
<B>
	NBCUniversal Media, LLC
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:4PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #0C6DFF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Conclusions regarding disclosure controls and procedures
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:2PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our principal executive and principal financial officers, after evaluating the effectiveness of NBCUniversal&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	13a-15(e)
</FONT>
	and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	15d-15(e))
</FONT>
	as of the end of the period covered by this report, have concluded that, based on the evaluation of these controls and procedures required by
	paragraph (b)&nbsp;of Exchange Act Rules
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	13a-15
</FONT>
	or
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	15d-15,
</FONT>
	NBCUniversal&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures were effective.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Management&#146;s annual report on internal control over financial reporting
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:2PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our management is responsible for establishing and maintaining an adequate system of internal control over financial reporting. Our system of internal control over financial reporting is designed to provide
	reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our internal control over financial reporting includes those policies and procedures that:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	pertain to the maintenance of records that, in reasonable detail, accurately and fairly reflect our transactions and dispositions of our assets
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
<B>
	121
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" NOWRAP ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	Comcast 2016 Annual Report on Form 10-K
</FONT>
</TD>

<A NAME="eolPage125"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D290430D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	provide reasonable assurance that our transactions are recorded as necessary to permit preparation of our financial statements in accordance with accounting
	principles generally accepted in the United States, and that our receipts and expenditures are being made only in accordance with authorizations of our management and our directors
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	provide reasonable assurance regarding prevention or timely detection of unauthorized acquisition, use or disposition of our assets that could have a material
	effect on the financial statements
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Because of its inherent limitations, a system of internal control over financial
	reporting can provide only reasonable assurance and may not prevent or detect misstatements. Further, because of changes in conditions, effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting may vary over time. Our system contains
	self-monitoring mechanisms, and actions are taken to correct deficiencies as they are identified.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our management conducted an
	evaluation of the effectiveness of the system of internal control over financial reporting based on the framework in
<I>
	Internal Control &#151; Integrated Framework
</I>
	(
<I>
	2013
</I>
	) issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the
	Treadway Commission. Based on this evaluation, our management concluded that NBCUniversal&#146;s system of internal control over financial reporting was effective as of December&nbsp;31, 2016. Our assessment of the effectiveness of internal control
	over financial reporting as of December&nbsp;31, 2016 did not include the internal controls of DreamWorks Animation, which we acquired on August&nbsp;22, 2016, as permitted by Securities and Exchange Commission guidelines that allow companies to
	exclude certain acquisitions from their assessment of internal control over financial reporting during the first year of an acquisition. The total assets and total revenues of DreamWorks Animation represented approximately 6% of NBCUniversal&#146;s
	total assets as of December&nbsp;31, 2016, and approximately 1% of its total revenues for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Changes in internal
	control over financial reporting
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:2PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	As a result of our acquisition of DreamWorks Animation on August&nbsp;22, 2016, NBCUniversal&#146;s
	internal control over financial reporting, subsequent to the date of acquisition, includes certain additional internal controls relating to DreamWorks Animation. Except as described above, there were no changes in NBCUniversal&#146;s internal
	control over financial reporting identified in connection with the evaluation required by paragraph (d)&nbsp;of Exchange Act Rules
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	13a-15
</FONT>
	or
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	15d-15
</FONT>
	that occurred during
	our last fiscal quarter that have materially affected, or are reasonably likely to materially affect, NBCUniversal&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<EFX_OTHER_INFORMATION>
<A NAME="FIS_OTHER_INFORMATION"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="4" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
<A NAME="D290430D10K_HTM_TOC290430_14">
</A>
	Item&nbsp;9B: Other Information
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Iran Threat Reduction and Syria Human
	Rights Act Disclosure
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:2PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Pursuant to Section&nbsp;219 of the Iran Threat Reduction and Syria Human Rights Act of 2012, companies are
	required, among other things, to disclose certain activities, transactions or dealings with the Government of Iran or entities controlled directly or indirectly by the Government of Iran. Disclosure is generally required even where the activities,
	transactions or dealings are conducted in compliance with applicable laws and regulations and are
<I>
	de minimis
</I>
	. As of the date of this report, we are not aware of any activity, transaction or dealing during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016
	that requires disclosure under the Act, except with respect to a January 2016 licensing agreement by a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-U.S.
</FONT>
	subsidiary of DreamWorks Animation prior to our August 2016 DreamWorks Animation
	acquisition.&nbsp;The agreement&nbsp;licensed a prior season of a children&#146;s animated television series for a three-year,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-cancelable
</FONT>
	term and for a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	one-time
</FONT>
	fee
	of $5,200 to a broadcasting company that is owned and controlled by the Government of Iran. The broadcasting company paid the license fee in the first quarter of 2016.&nbsp;We believe that DreamWorks Animation conducted its licensing activity in
	compliance with applicable laws and that the license is for the permissible exportation of informational materials pursuant to certain statutory and regulatory exemptions from U.S. sanctions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" NOWRAP>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	Comcast 2016 Annual Report on Form 10-K
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
<B>

</P>
<EFX_DIRECTORS_AND_OFFICERS>
<A NAME="FIS_DIRECTORS_AND_OFFICERS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="4" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
<A NAME="D290430D10K_HTM_TOC290430_15">
</A>
	Item&nbsp;10: Directors, Executive Officers and Corporate Governance
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
<B>
	Comcast
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:4PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #0C6DFF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Except for the information regarding executive officers required by Item&nbsp;401 of Regulation
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	S-K,
</FONT>
	we
	incorporate the information required by this item by reference to our definitive proxy statement for our annual meeting of shareholders presently scheduled to be held in June 2017. We refer to this proxy statement as the 2017 Proxy Statement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The term of office of each of our executive officers continues until his successor is selected and qualified or until his earlier
	death, resignation or removal. The following table sets forth information concerning our executive officers, including their ages, positions and tenure, as of the date of this Annual Report on Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	10-K.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
