<A NAME="eolPage159"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D290430D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	NBCUniversal Media, LLC
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	synergies and intangible assets acquired that do not qualify for
	separate recognition, including assembled workforce, noncontractual relationships and other agreements. We assess the recoverability of our goodwill annually, or more frequently whenever events or substantive changes in circumstances indicate that
	the carrying amount of a reporting unit may exceed its fair value. We test goodwill for impairment at the reporting unit level. To determine our reporting units, we evaluate the components one level below the segment level and we aggregate the
	components if they have similar economic characteristics. As a result of this assessment, our reporting units are the same as our four reportable segments. We evaluate the determination of our reporting units used to test for impairment periodically
	or whenever events or substantive changes in circumstances occur. The assessment of recoverability may first consider qualitative factors to determine whether the existence of events or circumstances leads to a determination that it is more likely
	than not that the fair value of a reporting unit is less than its carrying amount. A quantitative assessment is performed if the qualitative assessment results in a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	more-likely-than-not
</FONT>
	determination or if a
	qualitative assessment is not performed. The quantitative assessment considers whether the carrying amount of a reporting unit exceeds its fair value, in which case an impairment charge is recorded to the extent the carrying amount of the reporting
	unit&#146;s goodwill exceeds its implied fair value. Unless presented separately, the impairment charge is included as a component of amortization expense. We did not recognize any impairment charges in any of the periods presented.
</FONT>
</P>

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #0C6DFF">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	)&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #0C6DFF">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #0C6DFF">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	$
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #0C6DFF" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	19,460
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #0C6DFF">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #0C6DFF">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #0C6DFF">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	$
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #0C6DFF" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	(5,654
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #0C6DFF">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	)&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
	Indefinite-Lived Intangible Assets
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Indefinite-lived intangible assets consist of trade names and FCC licenses. We assess the recoverability of our indefinite-lived intangible assets annually, or more frequently whenever events or substantive changes
	in circumstances indicate that the assets might be impaired. We evaluate the unit of account used to test for impairment of our indefinite-lived intangible assets periodically or whenever events or substantive changes in circumstances occur to
	ensure impairment testing is performed at an appropriate level. The assessment of recoverability may first consider qualitative factors to determine whether it is more likely than not that the fair value of an indefinite-lived intangible asset is
	less than its carrying amount. A quantitative assessment is performed if the qualitative assessment results in a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	more-likely-than-not
</FONT>
	determination or if a qualitative assessment is not performed. When
	performing a quantitative assessment, we estimate the fair value of our indefinite-lived intangible assets primarily based on a discounted cash flow analysis that involves significant judgment. When analyzing the fair values indicated under the
	discounted cash flow models, we also consider multiples of operating income before depreciation and amortization generated by the underlying assets, current market transactions, and profitability information. If the fair value of our
	indefinite-lived intangible assets was less than the carrying amount, we would recognize an impairment charge for the difference between the estimated fair value and the carrying value of the assets. Unless presented separately, the impairment
	charge is included as a component of amortization expense. We did not recognize any material impairment charges in any of the periods presented.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	804
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">

	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Finite-lived intangible assets are subject to amortization and consist primarily of customer relationships acquired
	in business combinations, intellectual property rights and software. Our finite-lived intangible assets are amortized primarily on a straight-line basis over their estimated useful life or the term of the associated agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We capitalize direct development costs associated with
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	internal-use
</FONT>
	software, including external direct
	costs of material and services and payroll costs for employees devoting time to these software projects. We also capitalize costs associated with the purchase of software licenses. We include these costs in intangible assets and generally amortize
	them on a straight-line basis over a period not to exceed five years. We expense maintenance and training costs, as well as costs incurred during the preliminary stage of a project, as they are incurred. We capitalize initial operating system
	software costs and amortize them over the life of the associated hardware.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We evaluate the recoverability of our finite-lived
	intangible assets whenever events or substantive changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount may not be recoverable. The evaluation is based on the cash flows generated by the underlying asset groups, including estimated future
	operating results, trends or other determinants of fair value. If the total of the expected future undiscounted cash flows were less than the carrying amount of the asset group, we would recognize an impairment charge to the extent the carrying
	amount of the asset group exceeded its estimated fair value. Unless presented separately, the impairment charge is included as a component of amortization expense.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	(a)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	The December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015 amounts consist of &yen;382&nbsp;billion and &yen;400&nbsp;billion, respectively, of Universal Studios Japan term loans
	translated using the exchange rates as of these dates.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	(b)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	Includes the effects of our derivative financial instruments.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, our debt, excluding the note payable to Comcast, had an estimated fair value of $12.6&nbsp;billion and $13.4&nbsp;billion, respectively. The estimated fair value of our
	publicly traded debt is primarily based on Level&nbsp;1 inputs that use quoted market values for the debt. The estimated fair value of debt for which there are no quoted market prices is based on Level&nbsp;2 inputs that use interest rates available
	to us for debt with similar terms and remaining maturities.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Term Loans
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our term loans consist of the Universal Studios Japan term loans, which have a final maturity of November 2020. These term loans contain financial
	and operating covenants and are secured by the assets of Universal Studios Japan and the equity interests of the other investors. We do not guarantee these term loans and they are otherwise nonrecourse to us.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Debt Repayments
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Following Comcast&#146;s
	acquisition of DreamWorks Animation, we paid $381&nbsp;million to settle all of the debt we assumed in the DreamWorks Animation acquisition. In April 2016, we repaid at maturity $1&nbsp;billion aggregate principal amount of 2.875% senior notes due
	2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D290430D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	NBCUniversal Media, LLC
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Cross-Guarantee Structure
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We, Comcast and a 100% owned cable holding company subsidiary of Comcast (&#147;CCCL Parent&#148;) fully and unconditionally guarantee each
	other&#146;s debt securities, including the $7&nbsp;billion Comcast revolving credit facility due 2021. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, outstanding debt securities of $44.7&nbsp;billion of Comcast and CCCL Parent were subject to the guarantee
	structure.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We do not, however, guarantee the obligations of NBCUniversal Enterprise with respect to its $3.3&nbsp;billion aggregate
	principal amount of senior notes, $1.5&nbsp;billion revolving credit facility, commercial paper program, or $725&nbsp;million liquidation preference of Series A cumulative preferred stock.
</FONT>
</P>

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	4.25
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	%&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We have postretirement medical and life insurance plans that provide continuous coverage to employees eligible to
	receive such benefits and give credit for length of service provided before Comcast&#146;s acquisition of a controlling interest in NBCUniversal Holdings in 2011 (the &#147;joint venture transaction&#148;).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Substantially all of the employees that were contributed by Comcast as part of the joint venture transaction participate in a postretirement
	healthcare stipend program (the &#147;stipend plan&#148;). The stipend plan provides an annual stipend for reimbursement of healthcare costs to each eligible employee based on years of service. Under the stipend plan, we are not exposed to the
	increasing costs of healthcare because the benefits are fixed at a predetermined amount.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	All of our postretirement benefit plans are
	unfunded and substantially all of our postretirement benefit obligations are recorded to noncurrent liabilities. The expense we recognize for our postretirement benefit plans is determined using certain assumptions, including the discount rate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Pension Plans
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We sponsor
	various qualified and nonqualified defined benefit pension plans for domestic employees. Since the future benefits have been frozen since the beginning of 2013, we did not recognize service costs related to our pension plans for all periods
	presented. The benefits expense we recognized for our defined benefit plans was not material for all periods presented. In addition to the defined benefit plans we sponsor, we are also obligated to reimburse General Electric (&#147;GE&#148;) for
	future benefit payments to those participants who were vested in the supplemental pension plan sponsored by GE at the time of the joint venture transaction. These pension plans are currently unfunded and we recorded a benefit obligation of
	$314&nbsp;million and $309&nbsp;million as of December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, respectively, which consists primarily of our obligations to reimburse GE.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our consolidated balance sheet also includes the assets and liabilities of certain legacy pension plans, as well as the assets and liabilities for pension plans of certain foreign subsidiaries. As of
	December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, the benefit obligations associated with these plans exceeded the fair value of the plan assets by $62&nbsp;million and $67&nbsp;million, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	NBCUniversal Media, LLC
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Other Employee Benefits
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
	Deferred Compensation Plans
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We maintain unfunded, nonqualified deferred compensation
	plans for certain members of management (each, a &#147;participant&#148;). The amount of compensation deferred by each participant is based on participant elections. Participants in the plan designate one or more valuation funds, independently
	established funds or indices that are used to determine the amount of investment gain or loss in the participant&#146;s account.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Additionally, certain members of management participate in Comcast&#146;s unfunded, nonqualified deferred compensation plan. The amount of
	compensation deferred by each participant is based on participant elections. Participant accounts are credited with income primarily based on a fixed annual rate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In the case of both deferred compensation plans, participants are eligible to receive distributions from their account based on elected deferral periods that are consistent with the plans and applicable tax law.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The table below presents the benefit obligation and interest expense for our deferred compensation plans.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
	Retirement Investment Plans
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We sponsor several 401(k) defined contribution retirement plans that allow eligible employees to contribute a portion of their compensation through payroll deductions in accordance with specified plan guidelines.
	We make contributions to the plans that include matching a percentage of the employees&#146; contributions up to certain limits. In 2016, 2015 and 2014, expenses related to these plans totaled $185&nbsp;million, $174&nbsp;million and
	$165&nbsp;million, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
	Multiemployer Benefit Plans
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We participate in various multiemployer benefit plans, including pension and postretirement benefit plans, that cover some of our employees and temporary employees who are represented by labor unions. We also
	participate in other multiemployer benefit plans that provide health and welfare and retirement savings benefits to active and retired participants. We make periodic contributions to these plans in accordance with the terms of applicable collective
	bargaining agreements and laws but do not sponsor or administer these plans. We do not participate in any multiemployer benefit plans for which we consider our contributions to be individually significant, and the largest plans in which we
	participate are funded at a level of 80% or greater.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In 2016, 2015 and 2014, the total contributions we made to multiemployer pension
	plans were $84&nbsp;million, $77&nbsp;million and $58&nbsp;million, respectively. In 2016, 2015 and 2014, the total contributions we made to multiemployer postretirement and other benefit plans were $136&nbsp;million, $119&nbsp;million and
	$125&nbsp;million, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	If we cease to be obligated to make contributions or were to otherwise withdraw from participation in
	any of these plans, applicable law would require us to fund our allocable share of the unfunded vested benefits, which is known as a withdrawal liability. In addition, actions taken by other participating employers may lead to adverse changes in the
	financial condition of one of these plans, which could result in an increase in our withdrawal liability.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
	Severance Benefits
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We provide severance benefits to certain former employees. A liability is recorded when payment is probable, the amount is reasonably
	estimable, and the obligation relates to rights that have vested or accumulated. In
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	2016, 2015 and 2014, we recorded severance costs of $165&nbsp;million,
	$113&nbsp;million and $113&nbsp;million, respectively. Severance costs in 2016 included $61&nbsp;million of severance costs associated with the acquisition of DreamWorks Animation.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, we had unrecognized pretax compensation expense of $204&nbsp;million related to
	nonvested Comcast restricted share units (&#147;RSUs&#148;) and unrecognized pretax compensation expense of $28&nbsp;million related to nonvested Comcast stock options that will be recognized over a weighted-average period of approximately 1.9 years
	and 1.8 years, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Comcast maintains share-based compensation plans that primarily consist of awards of RSUs and stock
	options to certain employees and directors as part of its approach to long-term incentive compensation. Awards generally vest over a period of 5 years and in the case of stock options, have a 10 year term. Additionally, through its employee stock
	purchase plans, employees are able to purchase shares of Comcast common stock at a discount through payroll deductions. Certain of our employees participate in these plans and the expense associated with their participation is settled in cash with
	Comcast.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The cost associated with Comcast&#146;s share-based compensation is based on an award&#146;s estimated fair value at the date
	of grant and is recognized over the period in which any related services are provided. RSUs are valued based on the closing price of Comcast common stock on the date of grant and are discounted for the lack of dividends, if any, during the vesting
	period. Comcast uses the Black-Scholes option pricing model to estimate the fair value of stock option awards. The table below presents the weighted-average fair value on the date of grant of RSUs and stock options awarded under Comcast&#146;s
	various plans to employees of NBCUniversal and the related weighted-average valuation assumptions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;143
</FONT>

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #0C6DFF">

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We are a limited liability company, and our company is disregarded for U.S. federal income tax purposes as an
	entity separate from NBCUniversal Holdings, a tax partnership. For U.S. federal and state income tax purposes, our income is included in tax returns filed by Comcast and its subsidiaries, and therefore we are not expected to incur any significant
	current or deferred U.S. domestic income taxes. Our tax liability is comprised primarily of withholding tax on foreign licensing activity and income taxes on foreign earnings. As a result of our tax status, the deferred tax assets and liabilities
	included in our consolidated balance sheet at December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015 were not material.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In jurisdictions in which we are
	subject to income taxes, we base our provision for income taxes on our current period income, changes in our deferred income tax assets and liabilities, income tax rates, changes in estimates of our uncertain tax positions, and tax planning
	opportunities available in the jurisdictions in which we operate. We recognize deferred tax assets and liabilities when there are temporary differences between the financial reporting basis and tax basis of our assets and liabilities and for the
	expected benefits of using net operating loss carryforwards. When a change in the tax rate or tax law has an impact on deferred taxes, we apply the change based on the years in which the temporary differences are expected to reverse. We record the
	change in our consolidated financial statements in the period of enactment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We classify interest and penalties, if any, associated with
	our uncertain tax positions as a component of income tax expense.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Uncertain Tax Positions
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We retain liabilities for uncertain tax positions where we are the tax filer of record. GE and Comcast have indemnified NBCUniversal Holdings and us
	with respect to our income tax obligations attributable to periods prior to the close of the joint venture transaction, including indemnification of uncertain tax positions for these periods. The liabilities for uncertain tax positions included in
	our consolidated balance sheet were not material as of December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Various domestic and foreign tax authorities
	are examining our tax returns through tax year 2015. The majority of the periods under examination relate to tax years 2009 and forward.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D290430D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	NBCUniversal Media, LLC
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#0C6DFF">
<B>
	Note 15: Commitments and Contingencies
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:4PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #0C6DFF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Commitments
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We enter into long-term commitments with third parties in the ordinary course of our business, including commitments to acquire film and television
	programming, obligations under various creative talent agreements, and various other television-related commitments. Many of our employees, including writers, directors, actors, technical and production personnel, and others, as well as some of our
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	on-air
</FONT>
	and creative talent, are covered by collective bargaining agreements or works councils. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, the total number of full-time, part-time and hourly employees on our payroll covered by
	collective bargaining agreements was 8,500 full-time equivalent employees. Approximately 15% of these full-time equivalent employees were covered by collective bargaining agreements that have expired or are scheduled to expire during 2017.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The table below summarizes our minimum annual programming and talent commitments and our minimum annual rental commitments for office
	space and equipment under operating leases. Programming and talent commitments include acquired film and television programming, including U.S. broadcast rights to the Olympic Games through 2032,
<I>
	Sunday Night Football
</I>
	through the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	2022-23
</FONT>
	season,
<I>
	Thursday Night Football
</I>
	through the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	2017-18
</FONT>
	season, certain NASCAR events through 2024 and other programming commitments, as well as various contracts
	with creative talent.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Contractual Obligation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We are party to a contractual obligation that involves an interest held by a third party in the revenue of certain theme parks. The arrangement provides the counterparty with the right to periodic payments
	associated with current period revenue and, beginning in June 2017, the option to require NBCUniversal to purchase the interest for cash in an amount based on a contractual formula. The contractual formula is based on an average of specified
	historical theme park revenue at the time of exercise, which amount could be significantly higher than our carrying value. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, our carrying value was $1.1&nbsp;billion, and if the option had been exercisable as of
	December&nbsp;31, 2016, the estimated value of the contractual obligation would have been approximately $1.4&nbsp;billion, based on inputs to the contractual formula as of that date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	We present our operations in four
	reportable business segments: Cable Networks, Broadcast Television, Filmed Entertainment and Theme Parks. Our financial data by reportable business segment is presented in the tables below. We do not present a measure of total assets for our
	reportable business segments as this information is not used by management to allocate resources and capital.

	(a)

<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	The revenue and operating costs and expenses associated with our broadcast of the 2016 Rio Olympics and 2014 Sochi Olympics were reported in our Cable
	Networks and Broadcast Television segments. The revenue and operating costs and expenses associated with our broadcast of the 2015 Super Bowl were reported in our Broadcast Television segment.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

	our Filmed Entertainment and Broadcast Television segments to our Cable Networks segment.

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	(e)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	We use operating income (loss) before depreciation and amortization, excluding impairment charges related to fixed and intangible assets and gains or losses
	from the sale of assets, if any, as the measure of profit or loss for our operating segments. This measure eliminates the significant level of noncash amortization expense that results from intangible assets recognized in connection with the joint
	venture transaction and other business combinations. Additionally, it is unaffected by our capital structure or investment activities. We use this measure to evaluate our consolidated operating performance and the operating performance of our
	operating segments and to allocate resources and capital to our operating segments. It is also a significant performance measure in our annual incentive compensation programs. We believe that this measure is useful to investors because it is one of
	the bases for comparing our operating performance with that of other companies in our industries, although our measure may not be directly comparable to similar measures used by other companies. This measure should not be considered a substitute for
	operating income (loss), net income (loss) attributable to NBCUniversal, net cash provided by operating activities, or other measures of performance or liquidity we have reported in accordance with GAAP.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION_3"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="4">
	Report of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	To the Board of Directors and Stockholders of
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Comcast Corporation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Philadelphia, Pennsylvania
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We have audited the consolidated financial statements of Comcast Corporation and subsidiaries (the &#147;Company&#148;) as of December&nbsp;31,
	2016 and 2015, and for each of the three years in the period ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, and the Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting as of December&nbsp;31, 2016, and have issued our report thereon dated February&nbsp;3, 2017;
	such report is included elsewhere in this Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	10-K.
</FONT>
	Our audits also included the consolidated financial statement schedule of the Company listed in Item&nbsp;15. This consolidated financial statement schedule
	is the responsibility of the Company&#146;s management. Our responsibility is to express an opinion based on our audits. In our opinion, such consolidated financial statement schedule, when considered in relation to the basic consolidated financial
	statements taken as a whole, presents fairly, in all material respects, the information set forth therein.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	/s/ Deloitte&nbsp;&amp;
	Touche LLP
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Philadelphia, Pennsylvania
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	February&nbsp;3, 2017
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>

<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION_4"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="4">
	Report of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	To the Member of NBCUniversal Media, LLC
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	New York, New York
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We have audited the consolidated financial statements of NBCUniversal
	Media, LLC and subsidiaries (the &#147;Company&#148;) as of December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, and for each of the three years in the period ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, and have issued our report thereon dated February&nbsp;3, 2017; such report is
	included elsewhere in this Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	10-K.
</FONT>
	Our audits also included the consolidated financial statement schedule of the Company listed in Item&nbsp;15. This consolidated financial statement schedule is the
	responsibility of the Company&#146;s management. Our responsibility is to express an opinion based on our audits. In our opinion, such consolidated financial statement schedule, when considered in relation to the basic consolidated financial
	statements taken as a whole, presents fairly, in all material respects, the information set forth therein.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	/s/ Deloitte&nbsp;&amp;
	Touche LLP
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	New York, New York
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	February&nbsp;3, 2017
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;

	COMCAST CORPORATION

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	2003 STOCK OPTION PLAN
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	(As Amended And Restated Effective December&nbsp;5, 2016)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	1.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	BACKGROUND AND PURPOSE
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(a)
<U>
	Background
</U>
	. COMCAST CORPORATION, a Pennsylvania
	corporation hereby amends and restates the Comcast Corporation 2003 Stock Option Plan, (the &#147;Plan&#148;), effective December&nbsp;5, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(b)
<U>
	Purpose
</U>
	. The purpose of the Plan is to assist the Sponsor and its Affiliates in retaining valued employees, officers and directors
	by offering them a greater stake in the Sponsor&#146;s success and a closer identity with it, and to aid in attracting individuals whose services would be helpful to the Sponsor and would contribute to its success.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	2.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	DEFINITIONS
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(a) &#147;
<U>
	Affiliate
</U>
	&#148; means, with respect to any Person, any
	other Person that, directly or indirectly, is in control of, is controlled by, or is under common control with, such Person. For purposes of this definition, the term &#147;control,&#148; including its correlative terms &#147;controlled by&#148; and
	&#147;under common control with,&#148; mean, with respect to any Person, the possession, directly or indirectly, of the power to direct or cause the direction of the management and policies of such Person, whether through the ownership of voting
	securities, by contract or otherwise.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(b) &#147;
<U>
	AT&amp;T Broadband Transaction
</U>
	&#148; means the acquisition of AT&amp;T Broadband
	Corp. (now known as Comcast Cable Communications Holdings, Inc.) by the Sponsor.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(c) &#147;
<U>
	Board
</U>
	&#148; means the Board of
	Directors of the Sponsor.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(d) &#147;
<U>
	Cash Right
</U>
	&#148; means any right to receive cash in lieu of Shares granted under the Plan and
	described in Paragraph 3(a)(iii).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(e) &#147;
<U>
	Cause
</U>
	&#148; means (i)&nbsp;fraud; (ii)&nbsp;misappropriation; (iii)&nbsp;embezzlement;
	(iv)&nbsp;gross negligence in the performance of duties; (v)&nbsp;self-dealing; (vi)&nbsp;dishonesty; (vii)&nbsp;misrepresentation; (viii)&nbsp;conviction of a crime of a felony; (ix)&nbsp;material violation of any Company policy; (x)&nbsp;material
	violation of the Sponsor&#146;s Code of Conduct or, (xi)&nbsp;in the case of an employee of a Company who is a party to an employment agreement with a Company, material breach of such agreement; provided that as to items (ix), (x) and (xi), if
	capable of being cured, such event or condition remains uncured following 30 days written notice thereof.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage174"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(f) &#147;
<U>
	Change in Control
</U>
	&#148; means the occurrence of any one or more of the following
	events:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	following February&nbsp;22, 2016, any person or &#147;group&#148; (as defined in Section 13(d) of the Exchange Act) (each, a &#147;Person&#148;), other than an employee benefit plan or trust maintained by the Sponsor,
	becomes the &#147;beneficial owner&#148; (as defined in Rule
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	13d-3
</FONT>
	under the Exchange Act), directly or indirectly, of securities of the Sponsor representing 30% or more of the combined voting power of the
	Sponsor&#146;s outstanding securities entitled to vote generally in the election of directors, unless a majority of the directors of the Sponsor in office immediately preceding the date on which such Person acquires such beneficial ownership, by
	resolution negates the effectiveness of this provision in a particular circumstance);
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	at any time during a period of 12 consecutive months, individuals who at the beginning of such period constituted the Board and any new member of the Board whose election or nomination for election was approved by a
	vote of at least a majority of the directors then still in office who either were directors at the beginning of such period or whose election or nomination for election was so approved, cease for any reason to constitute a majority of members of the
	Board;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(iii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the consummation of (x)&nbsp;a merger, consolidation, reorganization or similar corporate transaction involving the Sponsor or any of its subsidiaries with any other corporation or entity, which would result in combined
	voting power of the Sponsor&#146;s securities entitled to vote generally in the election of directors outstanding immediately prior to such merger, consolidation, reorganization or other similar transaction representing (either by remaining
	outstanding or being converted into voting securities of the surviving entity or, if applicable, the ultimate parent thereof) less than a majority of the combined voting power of the Sponsor or such surviving entity or parent outstanding immediately
	after such merger, consolidation, reorganization or other similar transaction, or (y)&nbsp;any sale, lease, exchange or other transfer to any Person of all or substantially all of the assets of the Sponsor, in one transaction or a series of related
	transactions; or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(iv)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the approval by the shareholders of the Sponsor of a liquidation or dissolution of the Sponsor.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(g) &#147;
<U>
	Code
</U>
	&#148; means the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(h) &#147;
<U>
	Comcast Plan
</U>
	&#148; means any restricted stock, stock bonus, stock option or other compensation plan, program or arrangement
	established or maintained by the Sponsor or an Affiliate of the Sponsor, including, but not limited to this Plan, the Comcast Corporation 2002 Stock Option Plan, the Comcast Corporation 2002 Restricted Stock Plan, the Comcast Corporation 1987 Stock
	Option Plan and the AT&amp;T Broadband Corp. Adjustment Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	-2-
</P>

	(i) &#147;
<U>
	Committee
</U>
	&#148; means the committee described in Paragraph&nbsp;5, provided that
	for purposes of Paragraph 7:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	(i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	all references to the Committee shall be treated as references to the Board with respect to any Option granted to or held by a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Non-Employee
</FONT>
	Director; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	all references to the Committee shall be treated as references to the Committee&#146;s delegate with respect to any Option granted within the scope of the delegate&#146;s authority pursuant to Paragraph 5(b).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(j) &#147;
<U>
	Common Stock
</U>
	&#148; means the Sponsor&#146;s Class&nbsp;A Common Stock, par value, $.01.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(k) &#147;
<U>
	Company
</U>
	&#148; means the Sponsor and the Subsidiary Companies.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(l) &#147;
<U>
	Date of Grant
</U>
	&#148; means the date as of which an Option is granted.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(m) &#147;
<U>
	Director Emeritus
</U>
	&#148; means an individual designated by the Board, in its sole discretion, as Director Emeritus, pursuant
	to the Board&#146;s Director Emeritus Policy.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(n) &#147;
<U>
	Disability
</U>
	&#148; means:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	For any Incentive Stock Option, a disability within the meaning of section 22(e)(3) of the Code.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	For any
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Non-Qualified
</FONT>
	Option:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(A)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	An Optionee&#146;s substantially inability to perform the Optionee&#146;s employment duties due to partial or total disability or incapacity resulting from a mental or physical illness, injury or other health-related
	cause for a period of twelve (12)&nbsp;consecutive months or for a cumulative period of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	fifty-two
</FONT>
	(52)&nbsp;weeks in any two calendar year period; or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(B)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If different from the definition in Paragraph 2(n)(i)(A) above, &#147;Disability&#148; as it may be defined in such Optionee&#146;s employment agreement between the Optionee and the Sponsor or an Affiliate, if any.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(o) &#147;
<U>
	Fair Market Value
</U>
	.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<U>
	In General
</U>
	. If Shares are listed on a stock exchange, Fair Market Value shall be determined based on the
	last reported sale price of a
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	-3-
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage176"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Share on the principal exchange on which Shares are listed on the date of determination, or if such date is not a trading day, the next trading date. If Shares are not so listed, but trades of
	Shares are reported on the Nasdaq National Market, Fair Market Value shall be determined based on the last quoted sale price of a Share on the Nasdaq National Market on the date of determination, or if such date is not a trading day, the next
	trading date. If Shares are not so listed nor trades of Shares so reported, Fair Market Value shall be determined by the Board or the Committee in good faith.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Option Exercise and Tax Withholding
</U>
	. For purposes of Paragraph 7(d) and Paragraph 15 (except to the extent that the Optionee pays the full option price and all applicable withholding taxes in cash, by certified
	check or surrender or attestation to ownership of Shares, as described in Paragraph 7(d)(i), (ii) and (iii), respectively) the fair market value of Shares applied to pay the option price and the fair market value of Shares withheld to pay applicable
	tax liabilities shall be determined based on the available price of Shares at the time the option exercise transaction is executed.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(p) &#147;
<U>
	Family Member
</U>
	&#148; has the meaning given to such term in General Instructions A.1(a)(5) to Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	S-8
</FONT>
	under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, and any successor thereto.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(q) &#147;
<U>
	Incentive
	Stock Option
</U>
	&#148; means an Option granted under the Plan, designated by the Committee at the time of such grant as an Incentive Stock Option within the meaning of section&nbsp;422 of the Code and containing the terms specified herein for
	Incentive Stock Options;
<U>
	provided, however
</U>
	, that to the extent an Option granted under the Plan and designated by the Committee at the time of grant as an Incentive Stock Option fails to satisfy the requirements for an incentive stock option
	under section&nbsp;422 of the Code for any reason, such Option shall be treated as a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Non-Qualified
</FONT>
	Option.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(r) &#147;
<U>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Non-Employee
</FONT>
	Director
</U>
	&#148; means an individual who is a member of the Board, and who
	is not an employee of a Company, including an individual who is a member of the Board and who previously was, but at the time of reference is not, an employee of a Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(s) &#147;
<U>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Non-Qualified
</FONT>
	Option
</U>
	&#148; means:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	an Option granted under the Plan, designated by the Committee at the time of such grant as a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Non-Qualified
</FONT>
	Option and containing the terms specified herein for
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Non-Qualified
</FONT>
	Options; and
</TD>

<A NAME="eolPage177"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	an Option granted under the Plan and designated by the Committee at the time of grant as an Incentive Stock Option, to the extent such Option fails to satisfy the requirements for an incentive stock option under section
	422 of the Code for any reason.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(t) &#147;
<U>
	Officer
</U>
	&#148; means an officer of the Sponsor (as defined in section 16 of
	the 1934 Act).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(u) &#147;
<U>
	Option
</U>
	&#148; means any stock option granted under the Plan and described in Paragraph 3(a)(i) or
	Paragraph 3(a)(ii).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(v) &#147;
<U>
	Optionee
</U>
	&#148; means a person to whom an Option has been granted under the Plan, which Option has
	not been exercised in full and has not expired or terminated.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(w) &#147;
<U>
	Other Available Shares
</U>
	&#148; means, as of any date, the
	sum of:

	&nbsp;

	with the performance of services to the Sponsor or an Affiliate; plus

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1) the number of such Shares owned by such Optionee or such
	Optionee&#146;s Family Member for less than six months; plus
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2) the number of such Shares owned by such Optionee or such
	Optionee&#146;s Family Member that has, within the preceding six months, been the subject of a withholding certification pursuant to Paragraph 15(b) or any similar withholding certification under any other Comcast Plan; plus
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(3) the number of such Shares owned by such Optionee or such Optionee&#146;s Family Member that has, within the preceding six
	months, been received in exchange for Shares surrendered as payment, in full or in part, or as to which ownership was attested to as payment, in full or in part, of the exercise price for an option to purchase any securities of the Sponsor or an
	Affiliate of the Sponsor, under any Comcast Plan, but only to the extent of the number of Shares surrendered or attested to; plus
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;

	-5-

<A NAME="eolPage178"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(4) the number of such Shares owned by such Optionee or such Optionee&#146;s
	Family Member as to which evidence of ownership has, within the preceding six months, been provided to the Sponsor in connection with the crediting of &#147;Deferred Stock Units&#148; to such Optionee&#146;s Account under the Comcast Corporation
	2002 Deferred Stock Option Plan (as in effect from time to time).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For purposes of this Paragraph 2(w), a Share that is subject to a deferral election
	pursuant to another Comcast Plan shall not be treated as owned by an Optionee until all conditions to the delivery of such Share have lapsed. For purposes of determining the number of Other Available Shares, the term &#147;Shares&#148; shall also
	include the securities held by an Optionee or such Optionee&#146;s Family Member immediately before the consummation of the AT&amp;T Broadband Transaction that have converted into Common Stock.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(x) [RESERVED]
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(y)
	&#147;
<U>
	Person
</U>
	&#148; means an individual, a corporation, a partnership, an association, a trust or any other entity or organization.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(z) &#147;
<U>
	Plan
</U>
	&#148; means the Comcast Corporation 2003 Stock Option Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

<U>
	Share
</U>
	&#148; or &#147;
<U>
	Shares
</U>
	.&#148;

	The term &#147;Share&#148; or &#147;Shares&#148; also means such other securities issued by the Sponsor as may be the subject of an adjustment under Paragraph 10, or for purposes of Paragraph 2(w) and Paragraph 15, as
	may have been the subject of a similar adjustment under similar provisions of a Comcast Plan as now in effect or as may have been in effect before the AT&amp;T Broadband Transaction.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(bb) [RESERVED]
